instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello

I have got <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that not starting, and was stuck on 5v, and i had no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, i got to replace the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and now i have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
I can take the computer to DFU mode but the restoring can not finish its job.

By the way i have 20v right now.
I measured some more and find out that:
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> is 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> is not fix and jumping between 2.5 - 5v.

May i have some advices, I can not find the problem and i do not know where these power creates.

On the <SIGNAL>USB_C</SIGNAL> meter the arrow some times show toward the computer and some times are against. and no amp.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Any history available?
Check if SSD power rails are good.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 81362, member: 682"]
Any history available?
Check if SSD power rails are good.
[/QUOTE]
Could you please write the name of the rails.

pne friend told me that the T2 circuit that have problem, but which rails should I check?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Check at L9020/30/80 and L9520/30/80.

Write directly on the Reply box, do NOT click Reply button.
I don't see any reason to quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Thanks for your answer

 L9020, L9030, L9080 all of them are just 0v.

L9080/81 reads 100 on diode mode, i compared them to another board and they should read 376.

I got to replace <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> but it is still not working and same result

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"...  and L9520/30/80"
???

L9080 and L9580 should get similar readings in diode mode.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I do not have L9520/30/80 on the board

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Did you note liquid sign near <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: No, i found no sign of liquid.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Just as a history of the board, it seems that the board has been in another store before me and they have applied head on T2 chip <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.

I,m wondering if it got some problem there!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
You should not waste time in such machine.

SSD voltages must be present, to complete DFU process.
T2 has a dedicated firmware poartition there.
